blog.name: singingcookie
blog.title: Someone who talks way too much

tags: I was not expecting this ask???
but also like I have heavily considered this thought
ultimately I don't think her quirk would work on liquids
but it's entirely possible that's just where my head is at lol
thank you for the ask anon!!!
summary: Does Ochako's quirk work on liquids? If she patted a puddle could she be a waterbender?
question: Does Ochako's quirk work on liquids? If she patted a puddle could she be a waterbender?
answer:
Hmmmmmmmm…

Well, technically speaking, Ochako’s quirk only works when all five of her finger pads on one hand come in contact with something. (That’s why in a lot of Horikoshi’s artwork, she tends to have one finger lifted off whenever she’s holding things.) But with that said, you can’t fully touch a liquid in that way because of how liquids just tend to work. They move around when anything disturbs the surface of them and adjust accordingly.

But let’s assume that she lays her hands just on top of the surface of the puddle. Not pressing down, just resting them so the water is touching her fingers. In theory, it could possibly work. It depends on if each “droplet” of water counts separately or if the puddle itself counts as whole in her grasp.

For the sake of your second question, we’ll assume the latter. Technically, no she couldn’t be a water bender. We haven’t seen Ochako actively control and manipulate objects (or people) she has used her quirk on in the way that water benders manipulate water. She can make things float and she (it seems based off of her fight with Bakugou as well as when she used her quirk on Deku before the exam) can decide how high they float up. But that seems to be the extent of that.

tags: its both batman and bnha cannon and noone can tell me otherwise
summary: listen, if batman existed in the bnha universe, bruce wayne would be quirkless and campaign for great quirkless visibility BUT...
body: listen, if batman existed in the bnha universe, bruce wayne would be quirkless and campaign for great quirkless visibility BUT since everyone thinks batman has a quirk (bc how else would someone be able to take down villains the way he does?) noone suspects a thing.

summary: Просто представьте villain! Deku, который ведёт себя как яндерка и сталкерит Бакуго или Тодороки.  У него бы по всюду висели его...
body: Просто представьте villain! Deku, который ведёт себя как яндерка и сталкерит Бакуго или Тодороки. У него бы по всюду висели его фотографии, следил бы за ним из далека, а потом в один прекрасный день затащил бы его в подвал, где признался в своих чувствах.

blog.name: jacmyheroacademia
blog.title: MHA/BNHA Writings
blog.description: My Hero Academia writings! Scenario's, headcanons, and imagines. Ask whatever you like, we'll write mostly anything except NSFW- be nice and have fun!  || REQUESTS ARE OPEN || RULES || AUTHORS ||

body:
Toshinori X Inko- Dinner date?

Jac writing

Words: 1.1k

Warnings: none

This was a request


Toshinori smiled as Inko set down the food in front of him, both of them smiling at the delightful smell, “Thank you Midoriya-san, it looks amazing.” he said in gratitude, Inko smiling as she sat down across from him, “oh it was really no trouble.” she said easily with a wave of her hand, picking up her own chopsticks, “thank you for being willing to come over, I’ve been thinking about Izuku a lot lately now that he’s not living at home, and I was just so curious about what all of you had been working on.” she said sweetly, Toshinori nodding.

“That’s natural of a mother, and I’m always willing to help. Your son is growing exceptionally.” He answered kindly with a small smile. Inko smiled at this, “he always admired you so much as All Might, it’s nice to see that you are just as good a teacher in this form as your other- we can’t tell you how much we appreciate you.” she said kindly, taking a bite of her food.

Toshinori let out a soft chuckle, dipping his head in thanks. “You flatter me, but thank you. I do know that I still have much to learn, and I’m ready to do so alongside Izuku as well as provide guidance.” Inko smiled at this, “I think I can speak for everyone when we say we look forward to seeing the two of you learn together as he grows older- you know the boy is so destined on becoming the number one hero-” she laughed, “sometimes I worry about how much effort he is putting into it, that he’s not leaving himself time to actually be a teenager.” she told Toshinori, the man giving a small laugh in return. “I wouldn’t worry about that.” he said, thinking of Izuku’s sudden and new relationship with Ochako, as well as his good friendship with young Todoroki and Iida.

Inko smiled sweetly with a soft nod. “I know, it’s.. sometimes it’s just my job to worry, as his mother.” She replied with a shrug. All Might nodded. “And that’s normal, no one would blame you. He can be rather desperate to achieve his dream and prove himself at times, which can allow him to be reckless- but I do think he’s coming to realize that and begin to fix it for himself, alongside the help his peers and teachers give.” He tried to reassure

Inko nodded at this, both of them eating in silence for a bit longer until she spoke again, “I’m sorry, I’ve invited you over and only talked about my son-” she laughed, “tell me about you, do you spend time with family or with the other teachers on weekends?” she asked casually.

All Might waved off her concerns with a smile. “I mostly stay at the school, even during my spare time. There’s often a lot of work to get done planning out the lessons and discussing student progress.” He answered. Inko nodded but her smile fell a little bit, “but surely you see your family?” she asked curiously. Toshinori smiling sadly down at his food, taking another bite before responding, “the students and teachers of UA are my family … I don’t have much of anyone else.” he told her softly.

Inko frowned upon hearing that, her eyebrows creasing. “Oh, I- I’m sorry.” She said softly in a rush, Toshinori smiling softly as he recognized a hint of Izuku’s quick, profusely apologetic nature in her tone. “It’s quite alright- I got to live out my dream of being a pro hero without endangering those closest to me, and now that that job is passed I am surrounded by loving friends- including you and your son.” he said with a nod. He blinked in confusion as a slight hint of red crossed Inko’s cheeks as she nodded quickly, “well you are welcome here anytime!” she told him immediately. All Might chuckled softly with a grateful smile, dipping his head in a thankful nod. He was reminded yet again of his beloved mentor, seeing her within the loving pride Inko had shown in her gaze when she talked about Izuku, and how quickly she was to act when she saw the opportunity.

“Thank you, but I wouldn’t want to be a hassle.” He said with a chuckle, Inko quickly shaking her head. “It really wouldn’t be a problem, All Might. I miss the company, honestly.” She added with a shrug and a sheepish grin. He smiled back at her with a nod. “Toshinori.” He corrected. She blinked slightly in surprises, “what?” she asked questioningly, All Might smiling, “please, call me Toshinori, I don’t aim to be only seen as a pro hero.” he said kindly.

She blinked in slight startlement for a moment or two, nodding with a small smile. “Alright then.”

The two of them continued to make polite conversation as they finished the rest of their dinner, Toshinori bringing up the subject of Izuku again after they were almost done. “Where is young Midoriya tonight after all? It is the weekend, he should be at home resting.” he observed.

I no looked up from her food toward the clock at the end of the room, “he was out with friends, but he really should be getting home soon-“ she started right before the sound of the door opening interrupted her and she smiled with a small laugh as Izuku walked inside to remove his shoes.

“Hey mom- hey All Mi-“ he started before freezing and filling into a bow quickly. “All Might Sensei!” He said quickly, sounding flustered, “I didn’t know you would be here!” He exclaimed, looking between his mother and Toshinori who only waved off his nervousness. “Your mother was kind enough to invite me to dinner.” He said with a smile, Izuku eyes darting between the two adults skeptically.

“Is … this a date?” He asked, his mouth getting away from him before he could think of what he was saying. All might choked on his water as Inkonreddened quickly. “Izuku Midoriya!” She scolded, Izuku quickly reddening as he realized his mistake.

“Ah! My apologies- I’m sorry- I didn’t mean to-“ he rambled quickly. “Go clean up and you can eat with us- there’s food for you on the stove.” Inko said strictly, Izuku giving another small bow before bolting to his room, Toshinori rubbing the back of his neck awkwardly.

“I’m so sorry about that All- uh- Toshinori.” Inko said quickly, looking extremely embarrassed herself. “It’s really alright- no need to worry yourself.” Toshinori reassured quickly, but he couldn’t help himself from thinking that he wouldn’t mind it if this was considered a date.

The two of them continued to make polite conversation as they finished the rest of their dinner, Toshinori bringing up the subject of Izuku again after they were almost done. “Where is young Midoriya tonight after all? It is the weekend, he should be at home resting.” he observed.

Inko smiled at this, “he always admired you so much as All Might, it’s nice to see that you are just as good a teacher in this form as your other- we can’t tell you how much we appreciate you.” she said kindly, taking a bite of her food.

Toshinori let out a soft chuckle, dipping his head in thanks. “You flatter me, but thank you. I do know that I still have much to learn, and I’m ready to do so alongside Izuku as well as provide guidance.” Inko smiled at this, “I think I can speak for everyone when we say we look forward to seeing the two of you learn together as he grows older- you know the boy is so destined on becoming the number one hero-” she laughed, “sometimes I worry about how much effort he is putting into it, that he’s not leaving himself time to actually be a teenager.” she told Toshinori, the man giving a small laugh in return. “I wouldn’t worry about that.” he said, thinking of Izuku’s sudden and new relationship with Ochako, as well as his good friendship with young Todoroki and Iida.

Inko smiled sweetly with a soft nod. “I know, it’s.. sometimes it’s just my job to worry, as his mother.” She replied with a shrug. All Might nodded. “And that’s normal, no one would blame you. He can be rather desperate to achieve his dream and prove himself at times, which can allow him to be reckless- but I do think he’s coming to realize that and begin to fix it for himself, alongside the help his peers and teachers give.” He tried to reassure

Inko nodded at this, both of them eating in silence for a bit longer until she spoke again, “I’m sorry, I’ve invited you over and only talked about my son-” she laughed, “tell me about you, do you spend time with family or with the other teachers on weekends?” she asked casually.

All Might waved off her concerns with a smile. “I mostly stay at the school, even during my spare time. There’s often a lot of work to get done planning out the lessons and discussing student progress.” He answered. Inko nodded but her smile fell a little bit, “but surely you see your family?” she asked curiously. Toshinori smiling sadly down at his food, taking another bite before responding, “the students and teachers of UA are my family … I don’t have much of anyone else.” he told her softly.

Inko frowned upon hearing that, her eyebrows creasing. “Oh, I- I’m sorry.” She said softly in a rush, Toshinori smiling softly as he recognized a hint of Izuku’s quick, profusely apologetic nature in her tone. “It’s quite alright- I got to live out my dream of being a pro hero without endangering those closest to me, and now that that job is passed I am surrounded by loving friends- including you and your son.” he said with a nod. He blinked in confusion as a slight hint of red crossed Inko’s cheeks as she nodded quickly, “well you are welcome here anytime!” she told him immediately. All Might chuckled softly with a grateful smile, dipping his head in a thankful nod. He was reminded yet again of his beloved mentor, seeing her within the loving pride Inko had shown in her gaze when she talked about Izuku, and how quickly she was to act when she saw the opportunity.

“Thank you, but I wouldn’t want to be a hassle.” He said with a chuckle, Inko quickly shaking her head. “It really wouldn’t be a problem, All Might. I miss the company, honestly.” She added with a shrug and a sheepish grin. He smiled back at her with a nod. “Toshinori.” He corrected. She blinked slightly in surprises, “what?” she asked questioningly, All Might smiling, “please, call me Toshinori, I don’t aim to be only seen as a pro hero.” he said kindly.

She blinked in slight startlement for a moment or two, nodding with a small smile. “Alright then.”

The two of them continued to make polite conversation as they finished the rest of their dinner, Toshinori bringing up the subject of Izuku again after they were almost done. “Where is young Midoriya tonight after all? It is the weekend, he should be at home resting.” he observed.

I no looked up from her food toward the clock at the end of the room, “he was out with friends, but he really should be getting home soon-“ she started right before the sound of the door opening interrupted her and she smiled with a small laugh as Izuku walked inside to remove his shoes.

“Hey mom- hey All Mi-“ he started before freezing and filling into a bow quickly. “All Might Sensei!” He said quickly, sounding flustered, “I didn’t know you would be here!” He exclaimed, looking between his mother and Toshinori who only waved off his nervousness. “Your mother was kind enough to invite me to dinner.” He said with a smile, Izuku eyes darting between the two adults skeptically.

“Is … this a date?” He asked, his mouth getting away from him before he could think of what he was saying. All might choked on his water as Inkonreddened quickly. “Izuku Midoriya!” She scolded, Izuku quickly reddening as he realized his mistake.

“Ah! My apologies- I’m sorry- I didn’t mean to-“ he rambled quickly. “Go clean up and you can eat with us- there’s food for you on the stove.” Inko said strictly, Izuku giving another small bow before bolting to his room, Toshinori rubbing the back of his neck awkwardly.

“I’m so sorry about that All- uh- Toshinori.” Inko said quickly, looking extremely embarrassed herself. “It’s really alright- no need to worry yourself.” Toshinori reassured quickly, but he couldn’t help himself from thinking that he wouldn’t mind it if this was considered a date.

title: No More Heroes - decadentbynature - 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: Non-con, Underage

Relationships: Midoriya Izuku/Todoroki Shouto, Bakugou Katsuki/Midoriya Izuku, Bakugou Katsuki/Midoriya Izuku/Todoroki Shouto, Bakugou Katsuki/Todoroki Shouto, Midoriya Izuku/Shindou You, Bakugo Katsuki/Midoriya Izuku/Todoroki Shouto/Shindou You

Summary:

After getting a tip from Kirishima, the Pros rush in to rescue Midoriya from Bakugo’s control. Midoriya is saved but Bakugo escapes, vowing to return to claim what is his.

Wanting to help his friend, Todoroki steps up as Midoriya’s caretaker, determined to get him on the road of recovery. However, the damage Bakugo has done to Midoriya is too severe to reverse.

All Todoroki can do is shift his focus away from Bakugo, and onto him, though through extreme means. Just when it seems his tactics are working, Pro Heroes start to vanish without a trace.

Midoriya dreamily tells Todoroki that Kacchan is coming back for him. Kacchan always keeps his promises.

blog.description: Combining the thrilling world of sports with the incredible characters from My Hero Academia!

summary:
Pre-orders are now live for Olympian!   You
 can now order a digital and a physical copy of Olympian, a My Hero 
Academia...
caption:
Pre-orders are now live for Olympian!

You can now order a digital and a physical copy of Olympian, a My Hero Academia fanzine featuring your favorite characters and the world of sports. All proceeds will be going to the Special Olympics, after production costs are taken care of. These are only sneak peeks, so please purchase the zine to see the full pieces!

Pre-orders will be open for three weeks! (January 16th - February 6th)  

If you buy a digital copy of the zine, it will be emailed to you after a majority of pre-orders have been shipped. Physical copies will take a bit longer, so please check your email on updates with delivery!

Digital Copy

Physical Copy

Feel free to email littlehoneyfoxzines@gmail.com with any concerns or questions! You’re also welcomed to directly message this page!
